page.title: 04Farming in Weston and Area
page.content:
The presence of medieval field layouts and ridge furrows is indicative of the long history of farming in this area. Some families have farmed their land for generations and have farmhouses dating back to circa 1700 or earlier.
The soil in this area is reasonably fertile and suitable for arable, dairy and mixed farming. All the farms contacted combine arable farming (wheat, barley and rye grass) with grazing beef cattle.
The size of the farms sampled ranges from 105 to 400 acres, including some fields outside the area surveyed. The average size of fields is 15 to 20 acres. Most farms are family concerns. The owner of Oddington Grange has several farms in the area and has a peripatetic labour force.
